text: if you know me then you know how
obsessed I am with local economies when
I travel especially currencies maybe
that'll explain why I have an extremely
large currency collection at home
Bolivia Barbados Tajikistan Oman I've
handled some really high inflated
currencies like the Vietnamese dong I've
purchased currency on the black market
like the Uzbekistan Psalms and I've even
purchased trillions of old Zimbabwean
dollars the highest inflated currency
ever 100 trillion
but then I came to the Islamic Republic
of Iran and was immediately thrown into
the currency situation because they
don't have ATMs that cater to
international banks and nobody accepts a
foreign card as a payment so basically
what I'm telling you is that the only
way to survive here as a tourist is by
having cold hard cash the first day I
arrived I exchanged eight hundred US
dollars and got this 25 million Iranian
reals
aside from there being a lot of zeros to
calculate whenever you buy something it
gets even more confusing they have two
systems for counting money reals their
official currency like I just explained
and 2 Mon which is like the Rio without
the last zero to give you an idea look
at this note for example which is 500
thousand riyals let's people to make it
easier they just remove one of these
zeros so it's fifty thousand two month
when you go to buy something you don't
know if it's real or two mon unless it's
written so you have to ask is it in two
months
Taman so four million eight
you add one zero as a traveler you need
to ask if it's real or in too much and
sometimes in the market I've noticed
they say it's to two month but that just
confuses me even more yes that's that's
yada they were right because the local
people for five thousand two month
just to make it much easier they just
say five two months and even they have
the idea before when this money was
printed to remove the zeros so if you
look at here we can see just fifty is
right there whenever I am asked to pay
for something I stick my hand in my
pocket pull out a wad of cash and let
the guy choose which bill is the right
one it's really that confusing and I
still can't figure it out the takeaway
from this video is that many places in
the world not only Iran rely on cold
hard cash so if you're planning to come
here
just make sure you're prepared I'm drew
pinsky and if you like my travel videos
please click Subscribe and join me as I
plan to visit every country in the world
